authors.name: Sophia Lee
authors.note: Sophia helped develop and tested this protocol when she was an undergraduate researcher in the Nguyen Lab.

authors.name: Andrew Lin
authors.note: Andrew helped develop and tested this protocol when he was an undergraduate researcher in the Nguyen Lab.

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"cf4ne","text":"This protocol uses a dilution to extinction technique to isolate bacteria from soil but also applicable to other substrates. The isolation takes place in 96-well plates, thus allowed us to replicate the isolation in a high-throughput manner. The second part of the protocol uses high-throughput DNA sequencing to identify the samples. We amplified and sequenced \u003e900 isolates within one month working non-continuously. The estimated cost (without technician time) for each sample is approximately $3.50 and the cost will drop with more samples added to a single MiSeq run.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
protocol_references: {"blocks":[{"key":"1qt0n","text":"Zhang, J., Liu, YX., Guo, X. et al. High-throughput cultivation and identification of bacteria from the plant root microbiota. Nat Protoc 16, 988–1012 (2021). https://doi.org/10.1038/s41596-020-00444-7","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":29,"length":6},{"style":"italic","offset":127,"length":10},{"style":"bold","offset":138,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working. We amplified and sequenced >900 isolates within one month working non-continuously. The estimated cost (without technician time) for each sample is approximately $3.50 and the cost will drop with more samples added to a single MiSeq run.

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8vfhr","text":"Collect the soil (or sample) of interest. It is best to do the cultivation immediately after collection, but materials can be stored in the refrigerator overnight. Longer storage can affect the outcome if you are using this method for quantification.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f968d","text":"Prepare the collected soil. Any materials in the soil that is not the target of interest (e.g. roots, detritus) should be removed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3v9oq","text":"Homogenize the sample, including breaking of aggregates into fine particles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fsib9","text":"Weigh out   of the homogenized sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":10,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e9poc","text":"Media: This is a big topic and determines the outcome of what is being isolated. General laboratory broth media contain high amounts of nutrients and isn't necessarily reflective of the soil environment. It is recommended that a dilute medium be used for isolation to mimic slightly more natural conditions. We typically use a 1/10 dilution of tryptic soy broth for general isolation, and more specialized medium like soil infusion or root exudates for more specific microbes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"blpa2","text":"Calculations: Cultivation can occur in any number of multi-well microtiter plates. We generally use 96-well round bottom plates for ease of growth observation. Depending on the volume of each well, calculate the total amount of media for each plate. For a 96-well plate, we add   of media to each well, so you will need   of media total. We use   per plate to be safe.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":278,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":320,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":345,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"150","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"14.4","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"20","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dkvg5","text":"Add the homogenized sample into   of sterile medium.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":32,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8o17f","text":"Allow heavier particles to sink for  . Observe carefully to make sure that this is happening. No large particles should be visible.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":36,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":15,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2m715","text":"Allow the heavier particles to sink for  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":40,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":15,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"el0cr","text":"Dilutions: This protocol uses a dilution to extinction method to try and isolate single cells into each well of a microtiter plate. Since each sample can contain drastically different amounts of living cells, each experiment needs to test the appropriate dilution to achieve 1/3 to 1/4 of the plate being colonized. This is to minimize the chance of multiple organisms growing within any single well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fi59a","text":"Add the appropriate amount of the sample suspension prepared above to the growth medium to make a total of   per dilution series. These 4 dilutions series should be enough for most soil samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":107,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"50io2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bugo7","text":"10-1 or 1/10 dilution (  into   medium)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":2,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":23,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":30,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"93ei6","text":"10-2 or 1/100 dilution (  into   medium)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":2,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":24,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":31,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8tnr2","text":"10-3  or 1/1000 dilution (  into   medium)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":2,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[{"key":5,"offset":26,"length":1},{"key":6,"offset":33,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ckula","text":"10-4 or 1/10000 dilution (   into   medium)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":2,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[{"key":7,"offset":26,"length":1},{"key":8,"offset":34,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ciekq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5tg3u","text":"Troubleshoot: If you did not get any growth on the 10-1 dilution, use the undiluted (100) sample, dilute the original   of soil into   medium, or increase the soil sample to  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12},{"style":"sup","offset":53,"length":2},{"style":"sup","offset":87,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":9,"offset":118,"length":1},{"key":10,"offset":133,"length":1},{"key":11,"offset":174,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"20","error":false,"guid":"CF88FC7FA68711EEBB5B0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2000","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"10":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"11":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"18000","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"3":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"200","error":false,"guid":"5F4B9150A68711EEBB5B0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"4":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"19800","error":false,"guid":"5F4B91D2A68711EEBB5B0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"5":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"20","error":false,"guid":"8A26ED5BA68711EEBB5B0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"6":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"19980","error":false,"guid":"8A26EDD9A68711EEBB5B0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"7":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"0B1DB86CA68711EEBB5B0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"8":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"19998","error":false,"guid":"0B1DB8B8A68711EEBB5B0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"9":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bmnf9","text":"Pour a dilution into a sterile pipetting reservoir. Use a multichannel pipet to dispense   into each well of a 96-well plate. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":89,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"150","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"847k7","text":"Repeat for all 4 dilutions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"24dko","text":"Wrap at least two layers of parafilms around the plate, and secure the lid with lab tape. Place the plate into a ziplock bag to minimize moisture loss. Make sure your plates are labeled properly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d9pj9","text":"Incubate at the desired temperature and check periodically. For soil bacteria, we incubate them for at least 1 week, sometimes up to 2. However, you risk evaporation of your medium for longer or warmer incubations. For warm and/or longer term incubations, place the ziplock bag into a moist chamber inside the incubator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c8ois","text":"For each soil sample, determine the dilution plates that have visible growth in less than 30% of the wells. Plates with higher percentages of growth tend to have more mixed-culture wells. Discard plates that have higher number of wells with growth.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"88qp4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2kpn7","text":"Tip: To inspect for growth in your plate, set up an diffused light panel and place the plate on top. This will allow you to see which well has growth and which doesn't. Mark wells on the lid of the plate as appropriate. These lights can commonly be found in the lighting section of hardware stores or specialty lighting stores.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"81dl1","text":"Transfer all the contents of any wells with growth into a new 96-well plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"12m48","text":"It is generally recommended that you refresh the cells so that you don't lose any cultures. Use a 96-well replicating tool to inoculate a new 96-well plate with fresh medium. Incubate using the same parameters as isolation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d6h3p","text":"Storage: Add enough glycerol (or preferred cryopreservative) to each well so that they contain ~  glycerol. Freeze at  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":96,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":118,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"30","error_concentration":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":206}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7oo5u","text":"Post-identification purification: After identification and determination of purity of a sample, wells with mixed cultures of interest should be streaked out, isolated, and re-identified. Since working with 96 well-plates increases the chance of cross-contamination, any cultures from a well used in future experiments should be streaked out to ensure purity of isolate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":34}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"av54f","text":"Vortex for   to suspend the soil particles in the medium.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":11,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aa6p7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cfgst","text":"Pipet   of the suspension into 1L of medium. Do not include any large particles. Shake well to mix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":6,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9vt9p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ccqkc","text":"This protocol allows high-throughput identification of soil bacteria in
96-well plate format. It starts with an alkaline lysis of cells, followed by a
2-step PCR method that amplifies and barcodes the samples, then Illumina MiSeq
sequencing of a targeted variable region(s) of the rRNA gene, and a
bioinformatic workflow that cleans up the sequences and identifies the samples.
In our preliminary proof of concept trial, we amplified and sequenced >900
isolates within one month working non-continuously. The final estimated cost
(without technician time) for each sample is $3.50 and the cost will drop with
more samples added to a single MiSeq run. We expect that a single run could
handle 1500 isolates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aocut","text":"Transfer  of cell cultures grown in liquid medium to a fresh 96-well PCR plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":9,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5p3dt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2v4sl","text":"Pipet out as much of the growth medium as possible. We find that it’s difficult to pipet out more than  using a multichannel pipet and not disrupt the cell pellet. A bit of medium left over should not interfere with PCR.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":103,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9psb3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"75","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"248v4","text":"Spin down at   for  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":13,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":19,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"35q2l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"4000","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":180,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3m2en","text":"Add   of Extraction Solution (ES) to each well. Seal the plate with a sealing film and gently vortex to mix the cells into solution. Spin down quickly but do not pellet the cells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"129u8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"75","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6na68","text":"Pellet the cells by centrifuging at   for 3 minutes. The final DNA concentration is ~25 ng/µl. Use 1-2 µl of the clear solution for PCR (avoid the precipitate). For bacteria and yeast samples, we typically use   template in a   PCR reaction.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":36,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":210,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":226,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e0mee","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"4000","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"15","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8pehi","text":"Add   of Dilution Solution (DS) so that the final ES:ED solution ratio is 1:1.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5bk4f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"tij7","text":"Note: The recipes for Extraction and Dilution Solutions is available elsewhere.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":69,"length":9}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"75","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"32F6F2DE5F054F898831C08FDAD97A80","url":"https://docs.google.com/document/d/1jA8oZwfcOUJw4eHriZ3izwFqqVPVm3Ad/edit?usp=sharing\u0026ouid=114265720998633793925\u0026rtpof=true\u0026sd=true"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f9t8l","text":"For PCR, we use a two-step dual barcoding method to amplify and barcode each sample. For detailed methods, please see our lab's Illumina high-throughput sequencing protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":128,"length":44}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"84117D0BA73E11EEB2440A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://drive.google.com/a/hawaii.edu/file/d/1GqB5wmTdSlgHRVS_orGUBefE0H2uzlax"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1c06k","text":"Perform the 1st PCR using the gene primer with overhangs for the second primer. Samples should amplify well, and there should be little to no primer dimers left over. Check all samples for amplification using gel electrophoresis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":13,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6d2ml","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e487u","text":"Total reaction volume:  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":23,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"378ah","text":"Mastermix: Any good quality mastermix with relatively high-fidelity polymerase.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ro28","text":"Template:   of crude extract","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":10,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8k73k","text":"Primers:   (  each) final concentration of premixed pairs of primers.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":9,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":12,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"15","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"0.3","error_concentration":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":29}},"3":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"0.15","error_concentration":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":29}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a85n7","text":"Perform the second PCR using index primer mixes. If you have products in the first PCR, there is a very high chance that it will amplify in the second PCR. We do random spot checks (8 wells) across the plate to make sure that there is good amplification across the plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a36cn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fekhr","text":"Total reaction volume:  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":23,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"u83h","text":" Mastermix: Any good quality mastermix with relatively high-fidelity polymerase.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":1,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8k6el","text":"Template:  of first PCR","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":10,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4n8ui","text":"Primers:   (  each) final concentration of premixed pairs of primers. See the Nguyen Lab Index Primer setup.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":9,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":12,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":78,"length":23}],"data":{}},{"key":"aj60j","text":"PCR parameters: Same as the first PCR, except primer annealing is at 52 °C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"0.2","error_concentration":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":29}},"3":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"0.1","error_concentration":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":29}},"4":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"318AFED1A73F11EEB2440A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://drive.google.com/file/d/14J3X-q_0rXZbVP0YC8fRxsXS7JrO1yXv"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fkq97","text":"Combine all samples in equal volume. Here we assume that all samples have been amplified equally, and in our experience, amplification from the 2nd PCR tends to be uniform. We typically only use 2 µl per sample in this step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":145,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"49quj","text":"Perform SPRI bead cleanup on the final sample. Depending on how many samples you have, the final volume will exceed the limits of the tubes. For this step, we usually clean up  of the combined library. The cheapest way to do this is to buy a small, rare-earth magnet and set it up in such a way that it can interact with your tube in a rack. We simply tape it to the rack when needed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":17},{"key":1,"offset":176,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9grfj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"https://drive.google.com/a/hawaii.edu/file/d/11HbwOzbhFJNNaz2wInR84WpWpBTMdJWO"}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1ss6c","text":"Submit the sample to your favorite sequencing facility to be sequenced using Illumina MiSeq 300PE. Generally, we find that 1500 samples isn't enough for a run so we combine them with other microbiome amplicon libraries.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bf45f","text":"Use your favorite bioinformatics pipeline to identify the resulting cultures. Interpret your results carefully. Consider these points:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fdfbk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"chcpe","text":"Illumina sequencing can produce a good bit of noise, so an isolate may appear to be mixed but it isn't. In that case, you will need to determine what portion of the sequence is actual data and what portion is noise.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ac53e","text":"You will find that certain isolates have many copies of the 16 rRNA variants. This is not noise, but the true biology of the organism.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
